definition: A natural disaster characterized by a series of powerful ocean waves, typically caused by an undersea earthquake or volcanic eruption, resulting in widespread destruction along coastal areas. It is commonly used to describe a catastrophic event involving large-scale flooding caused by the displacement of water.

examples.german: Ein Tsunami traf die Küste Japans.
examples.english: A tsunami hit the coast of Japan.

examples.german: Die Menschen wurden vor dem Tsunami gewarnt.
examples.english: People were warned about the tsunami.

examples.german: Der Tsunami erreichte eine Höhe von 30 Metern.
examples.english: The tsunami reached a height of 30 meters.

examples.german: Der Tsunami hinterließ eine Spur der Verwüstung.
examples.english: The tsunami left a trail of devastation.
